column3: Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/67bfb20dd9752535aa74ab375d8c38699acf88dd for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu

The second clause is intended to explain the first, so isn't a colon appropriate?

> Bitcoin uses peer-to-peer technology to operate with no central authority:
> managing transactions and issuing money are carried out collectively by the network [instead of by a central authority].

Not really. It's more like:

"The road runs through a beautiful wooded valley; the railway line follows it."

than

"That is the secret of my extraordinary life: always do the unexpected."
I've asked around, and consensus seems to be that ';' is not really an improvement here (though ':' is awkward too), closing.\n
